source_title: City of Edmonton - Waste & Recycling / Eco Stations & Waste Management
fine_range: Varies by bylaw violation
notes_admin: City-wide solution for bulky item disposal; data from municipal programs.
schedule_pattern: Eco Stations open daily 8 am-6 pm; EWMC open normal disposal hours
eligible_items: Furniture
Mattresses / box springs
Appliances (non-refrigerant)
Electronics
Scrap metal
not_accepted_items: Paint / hazardous waste (at Eco Stations; some accepted at EWMC/Hazardous facilities)
limits: Vehicles up to 1-ton or 3 m trailer at Eco Stations; larger loads via EWMC
fees: Small bulky $11; large bulky $21; mattress/item surcharge $19; refrigerant appliance $21; other eligible items free; EWMC $72/tonne base
holiday_shifts: Facilities closed on statutory holidays; schedule shifts accordingly
notes_public: Residents drop off bulky items at Eco Stations or EWMC; Big Bin events free in season.
seo_text: Edmonton residents can drop off bulky items at any of four Eco Stations daily. Fees apply per item for furniture, mattresses, and refrigerant appliances. For large loads or oversized vehicles, use the Edmonton Waste Management Centre (EWMC). Seasonal Big Bin Events provide free disposal. Use Edmonton 311 to report illegal dumping or request more info.

source_title: City of Ottawa - Garbage (curbside) & Large/Bulky Items
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: Ottawa collects large household items curbside on garbage day; new three-item limit counts bulky as one item. Appliances are not collected curbside.
schedule_pattern: Set out by 7:00 a.m. on your regular garbage day; bi-weekly garbage. Bulky items count toward the 3-item limit.
eligible_items: Furniture
Mattresses / box springs
Toilets and sinks (dismantled)
limits: Maximum 3 items per collection (includes bulky). Each container <=140 L and <=15 kg. Place items curbside by 7 a.m.
fees: Curbside included in base service; drop-off fees apply at Trail Waste Facility by material or weight.
holiday_shifts: No collection on certain statutory holidays; collections shift to the next business day. Confirm via the city calendar.
notes_public: Put acceptable bulky items out with garbage on your collection day; appliances are NOT collected. For multi-unit buildings, coordinate through your property manager.
seo_text: In Ottawa, large items like furniture and mattresses are collected curbside on garbage day without an appointment and count toward the city's three-item limit. Appliances are not collected and must be taken to appropriate drop-offs. Check the collection calendar for holiday changes and report illegal dumping via 3-1-1.

source_title: City of Calgary - How to dispose of large household items
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: Calgary has no routine curbside bulk pickup. Residents use city landfills or Eco Centres or seasonal Community Cleanup events; HHW has separate depots.
schedule_pattern: Drop off during landfill and Eco Centre operating hours; Community Cleanup events run on select spring-fall weekends by neighbourhood.
eligible_items: Furniture
Mattresses / box springs
Appliances (including refrigerant units; surcharge applies)
Electronics (Eco Centres)
not_accepted_items: Household hazardous waste at landfills (use HHW drop-offs)
Unprepared mixed loads at Eco Centres
limits: Landfill minimum charge applies for loads <250 kg; loads must be secured or tarped. Some items only accepted at Eco Centres or HHW sites.
fees: Typical 2025 landfill rate $113/tonne; $25 minimum for <250 kg; refrigerant-removal surcharge for fridges and freezers. Some materials free at Eco Centres.
holiday_shifts: Landfills and Eco Centres operate on a statutory-holiday schedule; check the city's holiday hours page.
notes_public: Take bulky items to a city landfill or Eco Centre, or use Community Cleanup events when available. Check the HHW program for paint, chemicals, and similar items.
seo_text: Calgary does not offer routine curbside bulk pickup. Dispose of furniture, mattresses, appliances, and electronics at city landfills or Eco Centres, or bring them to seasonal Community Cleanup events. See current rates and holiday hours before you go, and report illegal dumping via 311.

source_title: City of Vancouver - Guide to residential waste disposal (Big items)
fine_range: $100-$10,000 for illegal dumping (bylaw); other fines vary by violation
notes_admin: City does not run a routine curbside bulky-item program; residents are directed to drop-off facilities (Zero Waste Centre, South Transfer Station, Vancouver Landfill).
schedule_pattern: Drop off during facility hours: Zero Waste Centre Monday-Saturday 8 am-6 pm; Sunday 9 am-6 pm; most statutory holidays 9 am-5 pm; closed Christmas Day and New Year's Day.
eligible_items: Furniture
Mattresses / box springs (drop-off limit applies)
Appliances / white goods
Scrap metal and many recyclables
limits: Mattress drop-off limited to 4 per customer per day (as of June 1, 2025). Disposal bans apply at Metro Vancouver facilities.
fees: Fees apply at the South Transfer Station and Vancouver Landfill (for example, 2025 under-1-tonne garbage $175/tonne; generator levy included). Many items are free at the Zero Waste Centre.
holiday_shifts: Facility hours change on statutory holidays; curbside garbage and recycling schedules follow the city calendar and may shift, so confirm online.
notes_public: Take big items to the Zero Waste Centre, South Transfer Station, or Vancouver Landfill. Check item-specific instructions in the Waste Wizard and review fees and limits before visiting.
seo_text: Vancouver residents should drop off bulky items like furniture, mattresses, and appliances at the Zero Waste Centre, South Transfer Station, or Vancouver Landfill. Many recyclables are free at the Zero Waste Centre; garbage and some materials have tipping fees. Report illegal dumping through Van311.

source_title: City of Austin - On-demand Bulk, Brush and Household Hazardous Waste Collection
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: As of January 2025, Austin Resource Recovery moved bulk, brush, and household hazardous waste services to on-demand scheduling. Each address can book up to three collections per year for each service; set-out time is 5:30 a.m.
schedule_pattern: Up to three on-demand collections per calendar year per service; schedule via Austin Recycles app, online, or 311; set out by 5:30 a.m. on the appointment day.
eligible_items: Furniture
Appliances (doors removed)
Household carpet
Lawn mowers (drain gas and oil)
Nail-free lumber and pallets
Passenger car tires (no rims; limit 8)
not_accepted_items: Boats, trailers, motorcycles, or tires on rims
limits: Maximum of three appointments per year per service; set items out by 5:30 a.m.; keep three separate piles; up to eight passenger tires without rims.
fees: Included in base Austin Resource Recovery service; extra-trash fees may apply if items are bagged as trash; tire fees apply at drop-off centers.
holiday_shifts: Collections may shift during holiday weeks; confirm through the My Schedule or Austin Recycles app.
notes_public: Book a bulk pickup through the Austin Recycles app, online, or by calling 3-1-1. Separate metal and rigid plastics from non-metal items and remove appliance doors.
seo_text: Austin offers on-demand bulk pickup: schedule up to three bulk, brush, and household hazardous waste collections per year. Set items out by 5:30 a.m., separate metal from non-metal, and keep piles clear of obstacles. Use Austin 3-1-1 to report illegal dumping.

source_title: Baltimore City DPW - Bulk Trash
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: DPW provides monthly bulk collection by appointment with up to three items per month. Call 311 or use 311 Online at least three business days before the scheduled date.
schedule_pattern: One bulk collection day per month per area; schedule via 311; set items where trash is normally collected and mark as bulk collection.
eligible_items: Furniture
Appliances (white goods)
Up to four tires (rims removed)
not_accepted_items: Sheetrock, siding, wood pieces, or roofing
limits: Maximum of three items per appointment with one appointment per month; place items at the normal collection point and clearly label them for bulk pickup.
fees: Free curbside bulk collection for residents; drop-off centers are available for additional materials.
holiday_shifts: DPW posts delays and holiday impacts on its Collection and Service Delay page; check for updates.
notes_public: Schedule bulk pickup through 311 and set no more than three items at your regular pickup location. Building materials are not collected via the bulk service.
seo_text: In Baltimore City, bulk trash is collected by appointment once per month with a three-item limit. Book through 311, set items at your regular pickup spot, and avoid placing construction debris. Check DPW's delay page for holiday or weather changes.

source_title: City of Boston - Special Collection Items
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: Furniture can go out on the regular trash day without an appointment. Appliances or electronics with Freon or CRTs require a Special Item appointment. Mattresses and box springs require a separate mattress recycling appointment; curbside pickup is free for buildings with six units or fewer.
schedule_pattern: Set furniture out by 6:00 a.m. on trash day; schedule special item and mattress pickups via BOS:311 with limits for each program.
eligible_items: Furniture (no appointment; curbside on trash day)
Appliances and electronics with refrigerants or CRTs (by appointment)
Mattresses and box springs (by appointment)
limits: Special Item collection is limited to 10 items per calendar year with a maximum of five per appointment. Mattress curbside recycling is limited to 10 items per year for eligible buildings with one to six units.
fees: Included in base service; curbside mattress pickup is free for eligible addresses with six units or fewer.
holiday_shifts: Collections may be delayed during holiday weeks; confirm using the Trash Day app or holiday notices.
notes_public: Put furniture out by 6 a.m. on your regular trash day. Schedule BOS:311 appointments for appliances, electronics with refrigerants, and for mattress recycling.
seo_text: Boston collects most furniture curbside on your trash day. Book BOS:311 appointments for appliances or electronics with refrigerants or CRTs and for mattress recycling. Use the Trash Day app to check holiday delays.

source_title: Trash and Recycling - City of Charlotte
complaint_channel: CharMeck 311 (phone 311 or 704-336-7600), online portal, or CLT+ app
fine_range: Not specified
notes_admin: Primary references include the City of Charlotte Collection Guidelines, Bulky Item Eligibility, and Solid Waste Services Administrative Policy (December 1, 2023). Verify the holiday list annually on the Trash and Recycling page; rules apply to addresses that receive city garbage service.
schedule_pattern: Schedule via CLT+ or 311. Set items at the curb by 6:00 a.m. on the confirmed pickup day and not earlier than the day before; unscheduled items will not be collected.
eligible_items: Household furnishings such as sofas, tables, and dressers (empty drawers)
Mattresses and box springs
Appliances and white goods (doors removed and emptied)
Electronics including TVs, computers, and monitors
Lawn equipment with fuel and batteries removed
Carpet, rugs, linoleum, or padding (rolled and cut per guidelines)
Doors, windows, mirrors, and glass (tape glass in an X)
Lumber, boards, pallets, and wood (nails removed and flattened)
Toilets that are empty and clean
Large toys, bikes, grills without propane tanks, and small heavy items under 75 lb
Up to eight passenger-vehicle tires with rims removed
Select metals and small appliances per eligibility list
not_accepted_items: Construction and demolition debris such as drywall, siding, roofing, insulation, plaster, or compound
Concrete, bricks, cinderblocks, rocks, sand, or dirt
Auto parts, motors, batteries, or tires on rims
Pressurized, propane, oxygen, or helium tanks
Hazardous waste including wet paint, solvents, or liquids
Railroad ties, chain-link fencing, or glass blocks
Large boat, camper, or motorcycle parts
limits: Service is available only to addresses receiving city garbage service. Items must generally weigh 75 lb or less and meet size and preparation rules such as taping glass, cutting wood, and removing fuel or doors. Place items by 6:00 a.m. on the scheduled day, no earlier than the day before; keep three feet of clearance from carts, mailboxes, and vehicles. Maximum of eight passenger tires per collection. Items placed without an appointment will not be collected.
fees: No additional fee for eligible residential customers; self-haul options at Mecklenburg County full-service centers may have separate disposal fees.
holiday_shifts: Collections occur on all holidays except Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Juneteenth, Thanksgiving, and Christmas. During those weeks all routes operate one day late, with Friday routes collected on Saturday.
notes_public: Bulky items must be scheduled. Set them out curbside by 6 a.m. on your confirmed day and not earlier than the day before. Keep about three feet between items and away from carts, mailboxes, and vehicles. Prepare items per city rules, including removing doors and fuel, rolling carpet, and taping glass. Items from contractors, construction debris, hazardous waste, and pressurized tanks are not accepted.
seo_text: Charlotte offers curbside bulky item pickup by appointment for furniture, appliances, electronics, and more. Schedule through CLT+ or 311, follow preparation rules, and review limits on weight, size, tires, and holiday delays.

source_title: Seattle Public Utilities - Special Item Collections (bulky item pickup)
complaint_channel: Report missed bulky or special-item pickup online or call SPU Customer Service at (206) 684-3000.
fine_range: Illegal dumping penalties range from $100 for a first notice of violation up to $1,500 plus cleanup costs, with additional criminal restitution of $50 to $100 per cubic foot depending on volume.
notes_admin: Program name on the SPU site is Special Item Collections. Fees and limits follow SPU guidance; scheduling and next-day rules come from the request portal. Holiday shift notes reflect SPU At Your Service posts. Illegal dumping reporting is based on the SPU Clean City program.
schedule_pattern: Schedule online or by phone; items are collected on the next regular garbage day after SPU confirms the request. Set out by 7:00 a.m. at the normal collection location on a flat, accessible surface.
eligible_items: Large furniture such as sofas, tables, chairs, dressers, and cabinets
Large appliances including stoves, dishwashers, dryers, washers, trash compactors, and air conditioners
Refrigerators and freezers containing CFCs (accepted with surcharge)
Mattresses and box springs
Televisions within size and weight limits
Electronics and small appliances such as monitors, CPUs, laptops, tablets, and cell phones
Household batteries bagged per SPU limits
Compact fluorescent lightbulbs bagged per SPU limits
Styrofoam blocks bagged per SPU limits
Small propane canisters under one pound
Special Items box for multiple small items up to two feet by two feet by two feet and 60 lb
not_accepted_items: Household hazardous waste such as oil-based paint, solvents, or pesticides
Large propane tanks or pressurized cylinders over one pound
Construction and demolition debris including concrete, bricks, drywall, or lumber
Dirt, rocks, or loose yard waste
Medical waste, sharps, or other biohazards
Items exceeding program size or weight limits (over 300 lb or longer than eight feet)
Electronics over 60 lb or larger than two feet by two feet by two feet for the small-item category
Items set only on stairs or in locked or inaccessible areas
limits: Appliances and furniture may weigh up to 300 lb and be up to eight feet long or four feet in diameter. Electronics and small items must fit in a box two feet by two feet by two feet and weigh 60 lb or less. Battery, CFL, foam, propane, and special item limits apply per SPU guidelines. Set items out by 7:00 a.m. on a flat, level, accessible surface.
fees: Foam blocks and used cooking or motor oil are collected at no cost. Battery, CFL, foam, and small propane pickups are billed at $5 per item type; special item boxes cost $20; large furniture, appliances, and large TVs cost $30 each; CFC appliances cost $38 each. Charges appear on the Combined Utility Bill, and eligible Utility Discount Program customers can receive up to two free pickups per year when scheduling by phone.
holiday_shifts: No collection on Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, or New Year's Day; service for affected days runs one day late for the rest of the week.
notes_public: Schedule bulky or special-item pickup online or by calling (206) 684-3000. After SPU confirms, place items out by 7 a.m. on your next regular garbage day at your normal set-out location on a flat, accessible surface. Fees vary by item and are billed to your SPU account.
seo_text: Seattle Public Utilities offers bulky item pickup by appointment for furniture, appliances, mattresses, and electronics. Review accepted items, size and weight limits, fees, and holiday delays, and report illegal dumping through SPU's Clean City program.

source_title: City of Detroit DPW - Curbside Collection Guidelines (2025)
complaint_channel: DPW Customer Service (313-876-0004); Improve Detroit 311 (app/web); call 911 if illegal dumping is in progress
fine_range: $65-$10,000 depending on violation (for example, early set-out of bulk items: $65 within 14 days or $105 after 14 days; maximum blight fines up to $10,000).
notes_admin: This record covers Detroit only to satisfy the single-object requirement. Policy details verified against the DPW 2025 Curbside Collection Guidelines (set-out rules, 2 cu yd limit, holiday shifts, accepted and not accepted lists) plus DPW refuse collection resources and blight fine schedules.
schedule_pattern: Bulk is collected weekly on the same day as trash. Set out by 7:00 a.m. Items must be properly packaged; do not place more than 2 cubic yards or over 1,000 pounds. Holidays shift collection one day later after New Year's Day, Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas.
eligible_items: Wood and lumber (bundled; remove nails and screws)
Cabinets (remove doors)
Carpet and padding (cut, rolled, tied; remove staples and nails)
Toilets
Paneling (bundled or in contractor bags; remove fasteners)
Tile (in contractor bags)
Drywall (in contractor bags)
Household appliances (remove doors; drain refrigerants)
Household renovation debris packaged per DPW rules
not_accepted_items: Batteries, medical waste, needles, radioactive materials, or chemicals
Hazardous waste (take to the Household Hazardous Waste Facility at 2000 E. Ferry)
limits: Maximum 2 cubic yards per pickup (about two stoves) and under 1,000 pounds total; each item, bag, or bundle under 50 pounds; debris under 4 feet in length; renovation materials must be bundled or in black contractor bags; keep bulk at least 6 feet from carts; do not mix yard waste with bulk or place items in front of vacant lots or homes.
fees: Standard curbside bulk pickup is included at no additional charge within limits. DPW offers paid pickup for excess bulk or renovation materials by quote (call 313-876-0004). Southfield Yard and Davison Yard accept up to 2 cubic yards or 1,000 pounds free. J. Fons Transfer Station charges for renovation waste (for example, $85 for the first 2,000 pounds); hazardous waste drop-off at 2000 E. Ferry is free on scheduled days.
holiday_shifts: Collection is pushed back one day following New Year's Day, Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report non-emergency dump sites via the Improve Detroit app or portal; call 911 if illegal dumping is in progress. Blight complaints can also be directed to the Ombudsman's Office at (313) 224-6000.
notes_public: Place bulk out by 7 a.m. on your trash day and keep items separated from carts. If you have more than 2 cubic yards, spread set-outs across multiple weeks or use DPW paid pickup or drop-off sites. Properly package renovation debris (bag or bundle under 4 feet and 50 pounds). Take hazardous materials to 2000 E. Ferry on designated days. Check your pickup day and sign up for reminders using the city's schedule tool.
seo_text: Detroit bulk trash pickup offers weekly curbside collection on your trash day. Set out up to 2 cubic yards, properly packaged, by 7 a.m. Find your schedule, review accepted items, note holiday shifts, and learn how to report illegal dumping.

source_title: City of Phoenix - Bulk Trash Pickup
complaint_channel: myPHX311 portal; City of Phoenix 311 Info Center (602-262-3111); Public Works Customer Service (602-262-6251)
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: Phoenix shifted to appointment-based bulk trash service in late 2024. Residents receive up to four appointments per year with a ten cubic yard limit. Details verified against Public Works bulk trash guidance and City Code requirements.
schedule_pattern: Book online or by phone. Set items at the front curb no sooner than seven days before the confirmed date and by 5:30 a.m. on pickup day; do not place items in alleys. Maximum pile is 10 cubic yards kept within 5 feet of the curb and 5 feet from fixed objects. Cancel at least three business days ahead to avoid losing an appointment. The scheduler blocks Halloween, Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's Day plus the seven days after each.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, tables, and mattresses
Small appliances without refrigerants such as microwaves
Toilets
Bagged grass, leaves, weeds, twigs, or hedge clippings
Tree trimmings cut to less than 12 inches in diameter and 4 feet long
Up to two wooden pallets
not_accepted_items: More than 10 cubic yards of material
Loose debris or loose yard waste
Household hazardous waste including antifreeze, pool chemicals, oils, batteries, and paint
Bagster bags or contractor bags containing debris
Bricks, concrete, dirt, rocks, asphalt, roofing shingles, or roofing tiles
Construction or demolition materials over 25 pounds or longer than 4 feet
Metal or automotive parts over 20 pounds or longer than 4 feet
Glass items such as windows, shower doors, mirrors, or fluorescent tubes
Tree trunks or stumps over 4 feet or over 12 inches in diameter
limits: City of Phoenix residential solid waste customers receive four appointments per year. One pile per appointment, maximum 10 cubic yards, placed within 5 feet of the curb and clear of obstacles. Yard waste must be securely bagged and limbs trimmed to less than 12 inches in diameter and 4 feet long. No combined piles between neighbors.
fees: Included with regular residential solid waste service; there is no separate fee for the four yearly appointments.
holiday_shifts: No bulk appointments are scheduled on Halloween, Thanksgiving, Christmas, or New Year's Day; the scheduler also blocks the seven days following each holiday.
notes_public: Phoenix bulk trash is by appointment only. Schedule online or by phone, set items at the front curb within seven days of service, and keep piles within size and clearance limits. Bag loose yard waste, cut limbs to size, and exclude hazardous waste, glass, tires, concrete, and refrigerant appliances.
seo_text: Phoenix bulk trash pickup is appointment-based. Schedule online, set piles at the front curb within the size limit, bag yard waste, and skip prohibited items like hazardous waste, tires, concrete, and refrigerant appliances.

source_title: Bulky Items - Recology San Francisco
complaint_channel: Recology San Francisco - Report Missed Collection
fine_range: Up to $1,000 per day administrative fine for illegal dumping (SF Public Works Code 1606); up to $1,000 for dumping in or around public trash cans (Police Code 35A).
notes_admin: Program name: Bulky Item Recycling (BIR). Key sources include Recology SF Bulky Items page (limits and exclusions), Accepted Bulky Items list, and Recology SF FAQ (single-family accounts with five units or fewer receive two pickups per year; multi-family buildings with six units or more receive one pickup per unit per year; unused pickups do not roll over; residents may combine both single-family pickups for up to 20 items depending on availability; service runs on all holidays except 12/25 and 1/1; set-out window requires a Recology sign; cancellations due by 12 PM prior business day). Scheduling page confirms the request process. SF Environment notes appointments are Monday-Friday (next available business day). Illegal dumping reporting via SF311 (web, app, or phone: 311, 415-701-2311, TTY 711 or 415-701-2323).
schedule_pattern: By appointment only with no fixed day. Appointments occur Monday-Friday. Single-family buildings with five units or fewer receive two pickups per calendar year at no extra charge. Multi-family buildings with six units or more receive one pickup per unit per year at no extra charge. Up to 10 items per appointment. Place items curbside after 6:00 PM the day before and by 6:00 AM the day of pickup; attach a visible sign reading "RECOLOGY". Cancellations must be made by 12:00 PM on the prior business day.
eligible_items: Furniture (couches, tables, chairs, dressers)
Mattresses and box springs
Residential appliances (washers, dryers, stoves, refrigerators)
Electronics (TVs, computers, monitors, peripherals)
Kitchen appliances (microwaves, small appliances)
Bathroom fixtures (toilets drained and boxed or wrapped per guidelines)
Clean textiles (bagged or boxed for reuse)
Garage items and scrap metal
Display cases
not_accepted_items: Recyclables such as bottles, cans, cardboard, or paper (use blue cart)
Yard or green waste (use green cart; no tree trunks)
Concrete, plaster, dirt, sand, or other construction and demolition debris
Oversized items such as pianos, tree trunks, cast iron tubs, or anything over 100 pounds
Hazardous waste (paints, pesticides, chemicals, cleaning agents)
limits: Maximum 10 items per appointment; items over 100 pounds are not accepted. Single-family accounts with five units or fewer receive two free pickups per year; multi-family buildings with six units or more receive one free pickup per unit per year; unused pickups do not carry over. Residents may combine both single-family pickups for up to 20 items depending on availability. Only active residential accounts are eligible. Set items out during the required window and label the pile with a "RECOLOGY" sign. Cancellations must be made by 12 PM the business day before.
fees: Included in residential collection rates for the allotted annual pickups (no additional charge). Additional pickups beyond the annual allotment are not currently available; alternatives include self-hauling to the SF Transfer Station (fees apply), donating usable items, or hiring a private hauler.
holiday_shifts: Recology provides uninterrupted service on most holidays; there is no collection on December 25 or January 1. If a scheduled appointment falls on those dates, service typically shifts to the following business day. Confirm details with Recology when scheduling.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping via SF311 online or app, or by phone: dial 311 within San Francisco, 415-701-2311 outside the city, TTY 711 or 415-701-2323.
notes_public: San Francisco residents can schedule a free curbside Bulky Item Recycling pickup with Recology for items that do not fit in their carts. Schedule online, list the items, then place them neatly at the curb during the set-out window and attach a "RECOLOGY" sign. Most furniture, mattresses, residential appliances, and electronics are accepted. Construction debris, hazardous waste, auto parts, tires, and items over 100 pounds are not accepted. Single-family accounts get two free pickups per year; multi-family buildings get one per unit. Illegal dumping on sidewalks is prohibited-report it through SF311.
seo_text: San Francisco's Recology Bulky Item Recycling program offers free curbside appointments for up to 10 items twice per year for smaller residential accounts. Schedule online, tag the pile with a "RECOLOGY" sign, follow the 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. set-out window, and note that multi-family buildings receive one pickup per unit per year. Report illegal dumping through SF311.

source_title: City of San Diego - Recycling Mattresses and Box Springs
complaint_channel: Environmental Services Department Customer Service 858-694-7000 (Monday-Friday 6:30 a.m.-5:00 p.m.); Get It Done app or web portal; after-hours illegal dumping call San Diego Police Department non-emergency 619-531-2000
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: The City does not provide bulky curbside pickup. Mattress and box spring disposal is handled through a free drop-off program. Guidance confirmed through Environmental Services Department resources including the 2025 curbside guide, Miramar Landfill fee schedule, and illegal dumping information.
schedule_pattern: No routine curbside bulky collection or appointments. The mattress drop-off site outside Miramar Landfill is open Monday-Friday 7:00 a.m.-3:00 p.m. and closed weekends and on City-observed holidays. Weekly trash service shifts one day later during holiday weeks.
eligible_items: Mattresses delivered to the City's mattress collection site outside Miramar Landfill
Box springs delivered to the City's mattress collection site
Other bulky items must be taken to Miramar Landfill, private haulers, or locations listed on WasteFreeSD.org
not_accepted_items: Any curbside placement of bulky items for City collection
Household hazardous waste, electronics, batteries, light bulbs, paint, motor oil, or chemicals
Mattresses that are wet, soiled, infested with bedbugs, severely damaged, twisted, or frozen
limits: No curbside bulky service. Mattress drop-off has no published item limit but materials must meet condition requirements and be self-hauled by residents during posted hours. Miramar Landfill loads must be covered and comply with landfill restrictions.
fees: Mattress and box spring drop-off is free through the Mattress Recycling Council. Miramar Landfill charges flat-rate disposal fees by vehicle type and applies a $50 uncovered load fee; weighed loads may require a deposit.
holiday_shifts: No collection on New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, or Christmas Day; curbside trash, recycling, and organics shift one day later for the rest of the week.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report via the City's Get It Done portal or call Environmental Services at 858-694-7000 during business hours; after hours call the San Diego Police Department non-emergency line at 619-531-2000 or 911 in an emergency.
notes_public: City-serviced homes do not receive bulky curbside pickup. Use the free mattress drop-off outside Miramar Landfill or haul other bulky items to Miramar, a private hauler, or a recycling option listed on WasteFreeSD.org. Do not place bulky items at the curb; illegal dumping is subject to enforcement. Confirm your service provider and holiday schedule through the City's lookup tool.
seo_text: San Diego does not offer curbside bulky pickup. Drop off mattresses and box springs for free at Miramar, and take other bulky items to Miramar Landfill, a private hauler, or a recycling outlet listed on WasteFreeSD.org. Report illegal dumping through Get It Done.

source_title: NYC Department of Sanitation - Large Items (Bulk)
complaint_channel: Report missed collection through NYC 311 online, the 311 app, or by calling 311 (212-NEW-YORK outside NYC)
fine_range: Illegal dumping civil penalties range from $4,000 to $18,000 with possible vehicle impoundment. Mattresses or box springs not sealed in plastic bags may incur fines up to $300. Residential set-out violations range from $50 to $200 depending on repeat offenses.
notes_admin: DSNY collects bulk curbside without appointments; up to six items may be set out per collection day. Metal and rigid plastic bulk is collected with recycling, while other items go out with trash. Mattresses must be bagged and electronics are banned from curbside disposal. Appliances containing CFCs require a free DSNY appointment.
schedule_pattern: Set out up to six bulk items between 6:00 p.m. and midnight the evening before your scheduled collection day. Place metal and rigid plastic items with recycling and other bulk with trash on the trash-only day. Schedule a free DSNY appointment before setting out CFC appliances; the item is tagged for pickup on the next recycling day after refrigerant removal.
eligible_items: Large furniture such as sofas, tables, desks, dressers, and bookcases
Wood furniture set out with trash on the trash-only day
Metal and rigid plastic items such as bed frames and file cabinets set out with recycling
Mattresses and box springs sealed in plastic bags
Rugs and carpets rolled and securely tied for trash day
Non-refrigerant appliances such as stoves, ovens, and washers set out with recycling
Refrigerators, freezers, air conditioners, dehumidifiers, and water coolers after DSNY removes CFCs
not_accepted_items: Electronics including televisions, computers, and printers covered by New York State e-waste law
Household hazardous waste such as paints, solvents, and pesticides
Construction and demolition debris including concrete, bricks, drywall, and large lumber loads
Gas cylinders, propane tanks, and fire extinguishers
Oversized or commercial appliances that cannot fit in a collection truck
Appliances using refrigerants not serviced by DSNY such as R600a or R32 units
limits: Set out no more than six bulk items per collection day within the 6:00 p.m.-midnight window. Mattresses and box springs must be sealed in plastic bags. Roll and tie rugs. Keep items on the curb in front of your property without blocking sidewalks or driveways. Electronics cannot be placed at the curb and require e-waste disposal programs. Refrigerant appliances require DSNY appointments and door removal.
fees: There is no fee for curbside bulk collection or for DSNY CFC removal appointments.
holiday_shifts: Collection is suspended on DSNY-recognized holidays. When service is suspended, set items out after 6:00 p.m. the evening before the next scheduled collection day and check the DSNY holiday schedule for alerts.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping through NYC 311 online, the 311 app, or by calling 311. Call 911 if dumping is in progress. Vehicle owners may face fines from $4,000 to $18,000 and vehicle impoundment.
notes_public: Bulk pickup in New York City is free and does not require an appointment for most items. Set out up to six items between 6:00 p.m. and midnight, bag mattresses, separate metal and rigid plastic for recycling, and schedule appointments for CFC appliances. Do not set electronics or hazardous waste at the curb.
seo_text: New York City's DSNY collects bulky items for free. Set out up to six items the night before collection, bag mattresses, separate metal for recycling, and schedule CFC appliance appointments. Use e-waste and hazardous waste programs for restricted materials.

source_title: City of Toronto - Oversized and Metal Items
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: Oversized items are collected on regular garbage day without appointments and with no item limits. Residents pay an annual Oversized and Metal Items fee that supports the service. Preparation standards require 0.5 meter spacing, appliance door removal, and secure bundling.
schedule_pattern: Set oversized items beside your garbage bin on the scheduled garbage collection day, leaving at least 0.5 meters (2 feet) of clearance around bins and items.
eligible_items: Furniture such as tables, sofas, lamps, and patio furniture
Mattresses and box springs
Metal items and appliances with doors removed
Carpets that are rolled, cut, tied, no longer than 4 feet, and no heavier than 20 kilograms
not_accepted_items: Household hazardous waste including paint, pesticides, and batteries
Construction or renovation debris such as drywall, lumber, and tiles
limits: There is no limit to the number of oversized items. Maintain 0.5 meters of spacing around bins and items, dismantle large or heavy pieces as needed, and follow special preparation rules for glass or bed bug infested items.
fees: Service is funded through the annual Oversized and Metal Items fee ($22.39 per home in 2025); there is no per-item curbside charge.
holiday_shifts: Some holiday weeks shift collection by one day; confirm using the City's collection schedule or holiday pages.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report dumping or litter issues through the City's bylaw enforcement portal at https://www.toronto.ca/city-government/public-notices-bylaws/bylaw-enforcement/litter-garbage/
notes_public: Place oversized items beside your garbage bin with spacing, remove appliance doors, wrap bed bug infested items, and take household hazardous waste or renovation debris to a Drop-Off Depot. Check your collection day online.
seo_text: Toronto collects oversized items curbside on garbage day with no appointment or item limit. Set items beside your bin with spacing, remove appliance doors, and use Drop-Off Depots for hazardous or renovation materials.

source_title: City of Winnipeg - Extra Garbage and Large Item Pickup
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: Large items are collected by appointment. Requests must be submitted at least two full business days before the regular collection day. Limits and fees follow the City's published guidance.
schedule_pattern: Request pickup through the City portal at least two full business days before your regular collection day. The City confirms the collection date for your items.
eligible_items: Large appliances
Furniture
Refrigerators or freezers (ozone-depleting substance handling fee applies)
Air conditioners
Extra garbage bags (fee per bag)
limits: Up to three extra garbage bags or up to ten large items per pickup. Typical maximum item size is 1.5 meters by 1.5 meters by 2.15 meters and weight up to 34 kilograms, except for appliances. Items must be set out after the appointment is confirmed.
fees: Fees apply and are billed to the utility account, including charges for extra bags, appliances, and items containing ozone-depleting substances.
holiday_shifts: Collection may shift on weeks with City holidays; check your schedule for updates.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping or property standards issues through https://www.winnipeg.ca/services-programs/bylaws-enforcement/property-neighbourhood-standards
notes_public: Schedule appointments before setting items out. Set items out only after confirmation, and use 4R Winnipeg Depots for hazardous waste or materials not accepted at the curb. Contact 311 for missed pickups or dumping concerns.
seo_text: Winnipeg's large item pickup is by appointment. Schedule online at least two business days ahead, set out up to ten items or three extra bags, expect fees on your utility account, and use 4R Winnipeg Depots for hazardous waste.

source_title: City of Philadelphia - Schedule Trash Collection for Bulky Household Items
fine_range: Varies by violation
notes_admin: The City offers free bulk pickup appointments for one-to-six unit properties. Up to four items can be scheduled per appointment, and items must be labeled with a pickup code. Regular trash day rules still allow two non-metal bulky items.
schedule_pattern: Schedule appointments online or via 311. Set items at the regular collection point after 7:00 p.m. (5:00 p.m. in fall and winter) the evening before pickup and by 7:00 a.m. on the day of service. Label items with the four-letter pickup code.
eligible_items: Refrigerators and major appliances with doors removed
Household furniture
Large toys
Flat-screen televisions
Passenger vehicle tires without rims (four tires count as one item)
not_accepted_items: Mattresses (set out on regular trash day and wrapped in plastic)
limits: Up to four items per appointment; City crews will not enter homes. Items must display the pickup code and be set at the regular collection point. Sanitation Convenience Centers accept additional metal items.
fees: There is no fee for City bulk appointments.
holiday_shifts: No trash or recycling collection on City holidays; collection runs one day late for the rest of the week.
notes_public: Book bulk appointments online or through 311, follow set-out times, label items with the pickup code, and use Sanitation Convenience Centers or household hazardous waste events for items not accepted in the bulk program.
seo_text: Philadelphia bulk trash pickup is free by appointment for eligible homes. Schedule up to four items, label them with the pickup code, set them out at the right time, and use City drop-off resources for anything not accepted.

source_title: City of Jacksonville - Household Bulk Collections
fine_range: Varies by violation; illegal dumping complaints are submitted through MyJax.
notes_admin: Bulk collection rules verified against City of Jacksonville guidance. Most areas receive curbside service without appointments, but appliances and tires require booking through MyJax. Automated collection areas accept limited DIY construction debris every other week.
schedule_pattern: Place items at the curb by 6:00 a.m. on your area's bulk collection day. Consult the address-specific schedule. Appliances and tires are scheduled through MyJax; other eligible materials follow the area's routine service.
eligible_items: Furniture such as mattresses, sofas, chairs, and grills
Glass that is wrapped and taped
Rolled carpet and padding up to 5 feet long
Bundled fencing with wood sections cut to 5 feet
Treated or painted wood cut to 6 feet
Small DIY construction debris in automated service areas on alternating weeks
not_accepted_items: Yard waste mixed with bulk piles
Unwrapped glass or oversize pieces exceeding published limits
limits: Keep piles within 5 feet of the curb. Most materials must be cut to 5 feet or less (treated or painted wood may be up to 6 feet). Bulk day frequency varies by service area. Small DIY construction debris is collected only in automated areas; contractors must remove their own debris.
fees: Included with residential solid waste service. Appointments through MyJax cover appliances and tire pickups.
holiday_shifts: Collections adjust only for Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day; New Year's Day follows a normal schedule. Check annual notices for details.
notes_public: Confirm your bulk collection day, set items out by 6 a.m., and schedule appliance or tire pickups through MyJax. Wrap glass, bundle fencing, and cut oversized pieces to the required lengths. Keep contractor debris, hazardous waste, and mixed yard waste out of the pile.
seo_text: Jacksonville bulk pickup offers curbside service by area with a 6 a.m. set-out time. Schedule appliances and tires through MyJax, follow size limits for glass, fencing, and wood, and keep contractor debris and hazardous waste out of the pile.

source_title: City of Oklahoma City - Bulky Waste
fine_range: Varies by violation; early set-outs may receive citations, and illegal dumping is reported through the Action Center.
notes_admin: Monthly bulky program confirmed through OKC Utilities documentation. Residents receive a three-day pickup window beginning the first Monday each month. The first 4 cubic yards are included; additional volumes incur fees.
schedule_pattern: Set items out by 6:00 a.m. on the assigned monthly set-out day with a three-day collection window. Do not set materials out earlier than three days prior to the assigned day.
eligible_items: Large and small household appliances (coordinate refrigerant removal with Utilities)
Furniture and carpeting
Fencing
Small amounts of DIY home-repair debris
Tree limbs from resident maintenance up to 10 feet long
Glass or mirrors that are wrapped and secured
limits: The first 4 cubic yards per pickup are included in base service. Additional fees apply for 4 to 10 cubic yards; piles over 10 cubic yards require pre-approval. Maintain at least 5 feet of clearance from obstacles and avoid setting out more than three days in advance.
fees: Standard service covers up to 4 cubic yards. The City charges excess bulky fees for larger piles; rates are published annually (for example, $13.86 for excess service as of January 2025).
holiday_shifts: Bulky waste operations continue on the regular schedule and are not affected by holidays.
notes_public: Review your monthly set-out calendar, place items curbside by 6 a.m., avoid bagging yard debris, and keep piles under 4 cubic yards to avoid extra charges. Call Utilities Customer Service for refrigerant appliances.
seo_text: Oklahoma City bulky pickup runs monthly with a three-day collection window. Set items out by 6 a.m., keep piles under 4 cubic yards to avoid fees, coordinate refrigerant appliances with Utilities, and report illegal dumping through the Action Center.

source_title: City of Milwaukee - Bulky Item Pickup Guidelines
fine_range: Illegal dumping fines can reach $5,000 under Department of Neighborhood Services enforcement.
notes_admin: Milwaukee provides limited curbside bulky service with a one cubic yard allowance on garbage day. Larger volumes require paid Special Pickup requests. Yard waste, electronics, appliances, and tires have separate programs.
schedule_pattern: Place up to one cubic yard of bulky waste at the regular collection point on garbage day. Submit a Special Pickup request for larger loads and follow the scheduled set-out instructions.
eligible_items: Broken furniture
Mattresses and box springs
Large broken toys
Small amounts of carpet cut to manageable sizes
Other household bulky items that do not fit in the garbage cart
not_accepted_items: Yard waste except during Project Clean & Green events
limits: Standard service includes up to one cubic yard per week. Special Pickups cost $50 for one to four cubic yards and $150 for four to six cubic yards; volumes over six cubic yards are not eligible and may incur enforcement action.
fees: One cubic yard is included with regular collection. Special Pickups require payment ($50 for one to four cubic yards; $150 for four to six cubic yards). Drop-off centers may charge additional fees.
holiday_shifts: Collection schedules may shift on weeks that include City holidays; check the address-specific schedule.
notes_public: Set out one cubic yard or less on your garbage day without a request. For larger loads, schedule a paid Special Pickup and follow drop-off center guidelines for electronics, appliances, tires, yard waste, and construction debris.
seo_text: Milwaukee bulky pickup covers one cubic yard on your garbage day, with fees for larger Special Pickups. Use Drop Off Centers for electronics, appliances, tires, yard waste, and construction debris, and avoid costly illegal dumping fines.

source_title: City of New Orleans - Trash Collection (Bulky Waste)
complaint_channel: NOLA 311 (dial 311 or 504-539-3266) or the MyNOLA portal
fine_range: Varies by violation; City Code Section 138-42 governs set-out timing and penalties.
notes_admin: Bulky service in New Orleans requires a request through NOLA 311. Residents of eligible small properties can schedule pickups for furniture, appliances, limited yard waste, and tires. Set-out timing is strictly regulated.
schedule_pattern: Submit a bulky item request via NOLA 311. Place items curbside no earlier than 24 hours before the scheduled collection day and by early morning on the regular solid waste collection day.
eligible_items: White goods and appliances such as refrigerators and washers
Furniture and mattresses
Carpet rolled and tied under four feet
Up to six bags of yard waste (bagged leaves, grass, or clippings up to 50 pounds each)
Up to six bundles of branches (each bundle under four feet long and 12 inches in diameter, up to 50 pounds)
Up to four tires
not_accepted_items: Household hazardous waste including batteries, fluorescent bulbs, and chemicals
Waste generated by businesses or properties with more than four units
Set-outs exceeding allowed quantities or placed out more than 24 hours early
limits: Service is available to residential properties with four units or fewer. Follow set-out timing rules, limit yard waste to six bags and six bundles, and limit tires to four. Carpet must be rolled and tied under four feet.
fees: Included with City residential solid waste service for eligible properties; no separate fee for scheduled bulky pickups.
holiday_shifts: In most neighborhoods, collection is suspended on New Year's Day, Mardi Gras Day, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day. During these weeks, pickup shifts one day later. French Quarter and Downtown Development District receive daily trash collection with some holiday exceptions.
illegal_dumping_reporting: If dumping is in progress, call the New Orleans Police Department non-emergency line at 504-821-2222. Report other incidents through NOLA 311.
notes_public: Request bulky pickup through NOLA 311, then set items out no more than 24 hours before your collection day. Accepted materials include appliances, furniture, small batches of yard waste, and up to four tires. Keep hazardous waste, electronics, and construction debris out of the pile.
seo_text: New Orleans bulky pickup requires a NOLA 311 request. Set items out within 24 hours of collection day, stay within limits for yard waste and tires, and keep hazardous waste, electronics, and construction debris separate.

source_title: Region of Peel - Bulky Items
complaint_channel: Region of Peel Waste Management (Waste Not Picked Up) at 905-791-7800 or online
fine_range: Illegal dumping fines range from $500 up to $100,000 under local bylaws.
notes_admin: Bulky items are collected on regular garbage day without appointments. Large appliances and electronics are handled through Community Recycling Centres. Item preparation rules confirmed through Peel Region guidance.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky items at the curb by 7:00 a.m. on your regular garbage collection day. No appointment is required; follow item-specific preparation rules.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, chairs, tables, and dressers
Mattresses and box springs
Barbecues without propane tanks
Rolled carpet or underlay cut and bundled within size limits
Ceramic toilets (maximum two with the tank removed and placed separately)
not_accepted_items: Large appliances and metal fixtures such as refrigerators, freezers, or water heaters
Household hazardous waste including paint, solvents, and automotive fluids
Construction and renovation debris beyond allowed preparation
limits: Cut and roll carpet to a maximum of 1.2 meters long and 76 centimeters wide. Toilets are limited to two per pickup and must have tanks removed. Remove propane tanks from barbecues and place items at the curb without blocking access.
fees: Curbside bulky pickup is free. Community Recycling Centre drop-off fees apply for certain materials, with dedicated loads of metals, electronics, and appliances accepted at no charge.
holiday_shifts: No collection on major holidays such as Family Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Civic Holiday, Labour Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas, Boxing Day, and New Year's Day; during those weeks collection is typically one day later, so confirm the schedule in the Collection Calendar.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping through Mississauga 311 or the Region of Peel's waste enforcement services.
notes_public: Mississauga curbside bulky service is handled by the Region of Peel. Set eligible items out by 7 a.m. on your garbage day, bundle carpets within size limits, remove propane tanks from barbecues, and take appliances or electronics to a Community Recycling Centre.
seo_text: Mississauga bulky pickup offers free curbside service on your garbage day. Set out furniture, mattresses, and other accepted items by 7 a.m., follow preparation rules, and take appliances and electronics to Peel's Community Recycling Centres.

source_title: City of Windsor - Residential Bulk Furniture Collection
complaint_channel: Call 311 or 519-255-CITY (2489); Windsor 311 online and mobile app available
fine_range: Varies by violation; illegal dumping may be referred to Windsor Police Service.
notes_admin: Windsor limits residential bulk service to furniture, requiring paid appointments through 311. Guidelines include two items per booking, weight and size limits, and preparation requirements.
schedule_pattern: Book through 311. Each collection zone has two dates per month. Set items at the curb (no alleys) after 7:00 p.m. the night before and before 6:00 a.m. on pickup day.
eligible_items: Mattresses and box springs
Couches, sofas, and sectionals
Sofa beds with mechanisms tied shut
Recliner chairs secured closed
Dressers and cabinets emptied with drawers removed
Kitchen tables, chairs, and non-metal desks
Bathroom vanities without porcelain components
not_accepted_items: Kitchen appliances such as refrigerators or stoves
Glass or mirrors (set with regular garbage when boxed and labeled)
Concrete, pallets, yard waste, or tires
Liquids, hazardous waste, explosives, or medical waste
limits: Maximum of two items per booking. Each item must weigh 200 pounds or less, measure no more than 1.2 meters wide and 2.4 meters long, and be manageable for a two-person crew. Payment is required by the Friday preceding pickup.
fees: Bulk furniture pickup costs $12.50 per item (tax included). Drop-off alternatives are available at the EWSWA Public Drop Off Depot, with fees varying by material.
holiday_shifts: Collections adjust around City-observed statutory holidays. Drop-off depots close on Sundays and most holidays; confirm dates when booking appointments.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping by calling 311 or Windsor Police Service non-emergency at 519-258-6111.
notes_public: Windsor's curbside bulk program is for furniture only. Schedule through 311, pay in advance, tie mechanisms shut, remove drawers, and keep items within weight and size limits. Take appliances, metals, electronics, and hazardous waste to drop-off facilities.
seo_text: Windsor residents can schedule bulk furniture pickup through 311 for $12.50 per item. Book ahead, follow set-out rules, and use the Public Drop Off Depot for appliances, electronics, or hazardous materials.

source_title: Halifax Regional Municipality - Garbage Collection (Bulky Waste)
fine_range: Varies by violation; illegal dumping complaints are investigated through Halifax 311.
notes_admin: Single-unit homes may set out one bulky item per garbage collection day; buildings with two to six units may set out two items. Items must weigh less than 200 kilograms and be shorter than eight feet. Appliances containing refrigerants require a CFC removal appointment and sticker before curbside collection.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky items out after 7:00 p.m. the night before and by 7:00 a.m. on garbage day; remove any uncollected items by 9:00 p.m. the same day.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, chairs, tables, mattresses, and box springs
Large appliances and white goods with a CFC sticker if required
Large household toys
not_accepted_items: Appliances with refrigerants that have not been degassed
Items exceeding eight feet or 200 kilograms
limits: Single-unit homes: one bulky item per collection. Buildings with two to six units: two bulky items per collection. Maximum weight 200 kilograms and maximum length eight feet.
fees: Curbside bulky pickup is included in regular service. CFC removal for eligible appliances is free. Otter Lake drop-off charges $13.04 per 100 kilograms (plus tax) with a $5 minimum for loads under 100 kilograms.
holiday_shifts: Follow the address-specific calendar and service updates; collection begins at 7:00 a.m. and times may vary during holidays or severe weather.
notes_public: Set only one bulky item beside your garbage (two for small multi-unit buildings). For fridges and freezers, request the free CFC removal service, wait for the sticker, then set the appliance out on garbage day.
seo_text: Halifax bulky pickup allows one item per garbage day (two for small multi-unit buildings) up to 200 kilograms and eight feet long. Set items out after 7 p.m. and by 7 a.m., and schedule free CFC removal before putting out refrigerant appliances.

source_title: City of London - Curbside Garbage Collection (Large Furniture and Bulky Items)
fine_range: Varies by municipal bylaw; enforcement handled by Municipal Compliance.
notes_admin: Large furniture or bulky items must be booked at least five business days before the next garbage day. Each booking covers up to four items with no annual cap or booking fee. Medium items within size limits can be set out without booking.
schedule_pattern: Book online or by phone at least five business days before collection. Set items out by 7:00 a.m. on garbage day, no earlier than 6:00 p.m. the evening prior.
eligible_items: Couches and sofas
Mattresses and box springs (wrapped if required by pest guidance)
Large wooden furniture such as bookshelves
Other bulky household items that meet size rules
not_accepted_items: Mostly metal items such as scrap metal furniture
limits: Bulk bookings allow up to four items per collection day with at least five business days notice. Medium items without booking are limited to two cubic metres per collection.
fees: There is no fee for bulky bookings. Drop-off fees may apply at EnviroDepots, such as appliance refrigerant removal or renovation material disposal charges.
holiday_shifts: During statutory holiday weeks, collection shifts forward one business day citywide. Confirm dates using the Collection Calendar.
notes_public: Use the Service London portal to schedule up to four bulky items for your next garbage day. Do not set out appliances, electronics, or renovation debris; take those materials to an EnviroDepot.
seo_text: London, Ontario bulky pickup requires an online booking five business days ahead. Schedule up to four large items like sofas or mattresses, set them out by 7 a.m., and use EnviroDepots for appliances, electronics, and renovation debris.

source_title: City of Vaughan - Garbage (Bulky Items) and Appliance Pickup
fine_range: Varies by municipal bylaw; fines may apply for improper set-outs or illegal dumping.
notes_admin: Non-metal bulky items such as furniture and mattresses are collected on regular garbage days and count toward the three-item garbage limit. Appliances and metal items are collected by paid Thursday appointments. Multi-residential properties require property manager bookings.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky garbage items at the curb by 7:00 a.m. on garbage day. Book appliance or metal pickup for Thursday service; set items out between 6:00 p.m. the night before and 7:00 a.m. on pickup day.
eligible_items: Furniture and mattresses up to 68 kilograms
Toilets with tanks removed
Appliances or large metal items with a paid Thursday appointment
Large household toys
not_accepted_items: Household hazardous waste such as chemicals or propane cylinders
Construction or renovation materials including drywall or lumber
Liquid waste, automotive parts, or tires
limits: Regular garbage limit is three items every other week; bulky items count as one item each. The City collects up to 13 items per location per day. Bulky items must weigh 68 kilograms or less. Multi-residential bulky service is provided through property manager appointments.
fees: Regular curbside bulky collection is included in service. Appliance and metal pickup costs $39 per appliance, with additional administrative fees for late cancellations.
holiday_shifts: Holiday notices such as Canada Day, Christmas, or New Year's may shift collection by one day. Check the waste calendar and City updates.
notes_public: On your garbage week, place large non-metal items at the curb by 7 a.m.; they count toward your three-item limit. Book and pay for Thursday appliance or metal pickup through Access Vaughan.
seo_text: Vaughan residents can set furniture, mattresses, and similar bulky items out by 7 a.m. on garbage day. Book Thursday appliance or metal pickups for $39 per item, and coordinate multi-residential pickups through property managers.

source_title: Ville de Longueuil - Collecte des encombrants
complaint_channel: Call 311 or 450-463-7311; submit service requests through the online citizen portal.
fine_range: Varies by municipal bylaw; enforcement can issue fines for improper set-outs or illegal dumping.
notes_admin: Residential addresses receive one bulky collection per month by sector, except during the peak moving period. Set-out window is between 6:00 p.m. the evening before and 7:00 a.m. on collection day. Businesses and institutions are excluded.
schedule_pattern: Follow the sector calendar for monthly bulky collection. Place items at the curb between 6:00 p.m. the night before and 7:00 a.m. on collection day; no appointment is required.
eligible_items: Upholstered furniture
Mattresses in protective bags
Carpets rolled and tied (roughly one metre per roll)
Large packing polystyrene tied together
Toilets
Stoves and other non-refrigerant appliances
Light fixtures
Garden hoses tied in bundles
not_accepted_items: Refrigeration or air-conditioning appliances that contain halocarbons
limits: Service is for residential properties only. Set items at the curb without blocking sidewalks or roads. Mattresses must be bagged, carpets and hoses must be tied, and items should not exceed practical bundle sizes. Refrigerant appliances and other excluded materials must be taken to ecocentres.
fees: Included with municipal residential waste services. Ecocentre drop-off remains free within annual visit limits.
holiday_shifts: Holiday week adjustments are reflected in the sector calendar; check the interactive schedule before placing items at the curb.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report issues by calling 311 or 450-463-7311, or use the online citizen portal. Call 911 for incidents in progress.
notes_public: Longueuil collects bulky items once per month by sector with no booking required. Check your calendar, place items out between 6 p.m. and 7 a.m., and bring excluded materials such as refrigerant appliances, electronics, or hazardous waste to an ecocentre.
seo_text: Longueuil offers once-per-month bulky collection by sector. Set accepted items out between 6 p.m. and 7 a.m., keep mattresses bagged and carpets tied, and bring refrigerant appliances, electronics, or hazardous waste to an ecocentre.

source_title: Ville de Laval - Encombrants
complaint_channel: Submit a report through Mon dossier or call 311 (450-978-8000 outside Laval).
fine_range: Waste management bylaw L-12424 sets fines from $200 to $1,000 for individuals and $400 to $2,000 for corporations.
notes_admin: Houses and buildings with up to 23 units receive bulky collection during one of the last two full weeks of each month by sector. Buildings with 24 or more units receive collection with regular garbage service. Refrigerant appliances are excluded and must go through the free GoRecycle program or an ecocentre.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky items out after 7:00 p.m. the night before and before 7:00 a.m. on collection day at the edge of your property. Confirm your sector schedule online.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, chairs, tables, and dressers
Appliances without refrigerants, including stoves, ovens, washers, and dryers
Drained water heaters
Carpets and rugs
Broken toys
Child car seats
Baths, showers, toilets, and sinks
Barbecues without propane tanks
Pool filters and parts that are emptied
Mattresses (bag if bedbugs are present)
Large branches, stumps, or trunks prepared per municipal guidelines
not_accepted_items: Refrigerant appliances such as refrigerators, freezers, portable air conditioners, dehumidifiers, or wine coolers
Items that exceed size or weight limits or are unsafe to handle
limits: Maximum volume is two cubic metres per address per collection, with items no longer than 1.8 metres. Items must be movable by two people. Large branches must be cut and arranged neatly, with small twigs placed in the brown bin. Program covers residential properties only.
fees: Curbside bulky collection is free. GoRecycle refrigerant appliance pickup is free, and ecocentre drop-off is free up to the annual allowance (12 cubic metres per address). Additional ecocentre volume costs $29 per cubic metre.
holiday_shifts: Collections generally operate on holidays except December 25 and January 1. Check the collection calendar for notices.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping through 311 or submit a Mon dossier request; call 911 if the situation is urgent.
notes_public: Laval provides monthly bulky pickup by sector with a two cubic metre limit. Set items out after 7 p.m. and before 7 a.m., keep items manageable for a two-person crew, and use GoRecycle or the ecocentre for refrigerant appliances and excluded materials.
seo_text: Laval's bulky collection runs monthly by sector with a two cubic metre limit. Set items out at the edge of your property after 7 p.m., keep materials manageable, and use GoRecycle or ecocentres for refrigerant appliances and hazardous items.

source_title: Region of Peel - Bulky Items (Garbage)
complaint_channel: Region of Peel Waste Management or Brampton 311
fine_range: Brampton refuse and dumping penalties range from $250 for a first offence to $750 for subsequent offences.
notes_admin: Brampton receives Region of Peel bulky service. Bulky items are collected free at the curb on garbage weeks, while appliances, electronics, and renovation materials must be taken to Community Recycling Centres.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky items at the curb by 7:00 a.m. on garbage collection weeks and keep them about one metre from bins or obstacles.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, chairs, dressers, and bed frames
Mattresses and box springs
Barbecues with propane tanks removed
Carpet or underlay cut, rolled, and tied within size limits
Ceramic toilets with tank removed and a maximum of two per pickup
not_accepted_items: Large appliances including refrigerators or stoves
Electronics such as televisions and computers
limits: Bulky items are collected only on garbage weeks. Place items by 7:00 a.m. with about one metre of clearance. Remove propane tanks from barbecues, separate toilet tanks and bowls, and tie carpet bundles within size limits.
fees: Curbside bulky collection is free. Community Recycling Centre drop-off fees start at $7 per chargeable load, with dedicated loads of metals, electronics, and appliances accepted free. Payments are by debit or credit only.
holiday_shifts: Certain statutory holidays shift collection by one day. Confirm schedules through the Region's collection calendar.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping through Brampton 311 or Region of Peel online services. Call Peel Regional Police for incidents in progress.
notes_public: Place bulky items out on garbage weeks by 7 a.m. Keep items clear of bins, remove propane tanks from barbecues, and separate toilet components. Take appliances, electronics, and renovation debris to a Community Recycling Centre.
seo_text: Brampton bulky pickup runs on garbage weeks at no extra cost. Set out furniture, mattresses, barbecues without tanks, and carpet bundles by 7 a.m., and use Peel Community Recycling Centres for appliances, electronics, and renovation waste.

source_title: Halton Region - Curbside Collection and Waste Sorting Guide
fine_range: Varies by bylaw violation.
notes_admin: Halton Region collects bulky waste every other week on garbage day with a three-item limit. Items must be set out by 7:00 a.m. and not earlier than 5:00 p.m. the evening before. Metal items and appliances require appointments.
schedule_pattern: Bulk items: every other week on garbage day; set out by 7:00 a.m. and no earlier than 5:00 p.m. the previous evening. Metal and appliances: schedule a free appointment before setting out.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, chairs, and tables
Mattresses and box springs wrapped and sealed in plastic
Carpet and underpadding bundled to 1.2 meters by 0.76 meters
Toilets with tanks separated
Wood items including fencing or shelving bundled to 1.2 meters by 0.76 meters
Windows or mirrors taped in an X pattern
limits: Set out no more than three bulky items per collection. Items that fit in a closed bag or container are not considered bulk.
fees: Curbside bulky pickup is included. Metal and appliance pickup is free by appointment. Tipping fees apply at the Halton Waste Management Site.
holiday_shifts: Holiday weeks may alter collection schedules; confirm via the Online Waste Collection Schedule.
notes_public: Place up to three bulky items next to your garbage by 7 a.m. on garbage weeks. Book metal or appliance pickups in advance or use the Halton Waste Management Site for special items.
seo_text: Oakville bulk pickup runs every other week on garbage day with a three-item limit. Wrap mattresses, bundle carpets and wood to size, and schedule free metal or appliance pickups through Halton Region.

source_title: Halton Region - Curbside Collection and Waste Sorting Guide
fine_range: Varies by bylaw violation.
notes_admin: Halton Region collects bulky items every other week with a three-item limit. Metal items and appliances must be booked separately through the Region's appointment service.
schedule_pattern: Bulk items: every other week on garbage day by 7:00 a.m., not earlier than 5:00 p.m. the evening before. Metal and appliances: booked appointment required.
eligible_items: Furniture including tables, sofas, and chairs
Mattresses and box springs wrapped and sealed in plastic
Carpet and underpadding bundled to 1.2 meters by 0.76 meters
Disassembled toilets
Wood items bundled to 1.2 meters by 0.76 meters
Windows or mirrors taped before set-out
limits: Set out a maximum of three bulky items per collection. Do not pile items; only loose oversized items count as bulk.
fees: Curbside bulky collection is included in base service. Metal and appliance pickups are free by appointment. Halton Waste Management Site charges tipping fees for certain drop-offs.
holiday_shifts: Holiday weeks may shift collection schedules; use the online waste collection tools to confirm.
notes_public: Set out up to three bulky items on your garbage week by 7 a.m. Wrap mattresses, bundle materials to size, and pre-book free metal or appliance pickups.
seo_text: Burlington bulky pickup allows three items every other week on garbage day. Wrap mattresses, bundle wood and carpets, and book free metal or appliance pickup in advance through Halton Region.

source_title: City of Richmond - Large Item Pick Up
fine_range: Illegal dumping fines can reach $1,000.
notes_admin: Eligible residents may book up to six large item pickups per year through the City's contractor. Some strata properties are ineligible and must arrange alternative disposal.
schedule_pattern: Schedule through Sierra Waste by 4:00 p.m. the Thursday before the next garbage day. Set items out after 8:00 p.m. the night before or by 7:30 a.m. on pickup day.
eligible_items: Appliances such as stoves, washers, dryers, and refrigerators (propane removed)
Furniture including sofas and upholstered items that are dry
Mattresses and box springs wrapped and sealed in plastic
Bed frames and headboards
Outdoor furniture
Small household goods packaged in boxes or bundles counted as one item
Electric lawnmowers
Passenger or light-duty tires
Weight-training equipment
not_accepted_items: Wet or unsealed mattresses and upholstered furniture
limits: Six large items per address per calendar year. Items must be dry, manageable, and accessible from the curb.
fees: Service is included for eligible addresses. Additional items must be taken to disposal facilities at the resident's cost.
holiday_shifts: Consult the City calendar and appointment confirmation for holiday changes.
notes_public: Book up to six large item pickups per year through the City. Set items out after 8 p.m. before pickup day, wrap mattresses, and keep upholstered furniture dry.
seo_text: Richmond's Large Item Pick Up lets eligible homes book up to six bulky items per year. Schedule with Sierra Waste, wrap mattresses in plastic, keep furniture dry, and report illegal dumping to the City.

source_title: City of Burnaby - Large Item Pickup
fine_range: Varies by municipal enforcement; illegal dumping penalties may apply.
notes_admin: Burnaby offers free on-call large item pickup for households with City curbside collection. Houses and duplexes may set out up to three items per pickup; multi-family complexes up to six items per appointment.
schedule_pattern: Submit a request online or call 604-294-7972. After receiving the confirmed date and location, set items out at the specified spot before the scheduled time.
eligible_items: Large kitchen and laundry appliances
Hot water tanks
Air conditioners
Large standing barbecues with propane tanks removed
Patio furniture (excluding umbrellas)
Bed frames and box springs
Stand-alone cabinets, shelves, and nightstands
Small area rugs under five feet
Dressers, desks, tables, and entertainment units
Chairs, couches, sofas, ottomans, and recliners
Baby cribs
Toilets
Mattresses thicker than four inches wrapped and sealed in plastic
Mirrors wrapped for safety
limits: Houses and duplexes can place three items per pickup. Multi-family complexes can place six items per appointment and must use the designated setout location. Mattresses must be wrapped and mirrors must be protected.
fees: No cost for eligible City customers.
holiday_shifts: Large item appointments do not occur on City-recognized statutory holidays; if your booking overlaps a holiday, the confirmation notice will provide the rescheduled pickup date.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report issues to Solid Waste and Recycling at 604-294-7972 or through the BurnabyConnect app.
notes_public: Burnaby's large item pickup is by appointment. Schedule online or by phone, follow the City's setout instructions, wrap mattresses, and use other disposal options for electronics or renovation debris.
seo_text: Burnaby offers free on-call large item pickup for furniture, mattresses, and appliances. Houses can set out three items, multi-family complexes six items. Wrap mattresses, follow setout directions, and contact Solid Waste and Recycling for help.

source_title: Ville de Gatineau - Encombrants
fine_range: Nuisances and residual materials bylaws levy fines from $300 to $1,000 for individuals and $600 to $2,000 for legal persons.
notes_admin: Bulky collections are scheduled through the DTRITUS app with up to 18 dates per year. Residents can book four items per request, or up to twelve for multi-residential properties. Items must be categorized correctly and placed at the curb within the allowed timeframe.
schedule_pattern: Book through DTRITUS. Set items out after 7:00 p.m. the night before or before 7:00 a.m. on collection day at the edge of your property.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, tables, chairs, and dressers
Mattresses and box springs
Wood or metal items including bed frames and interior doors
Non-refrigerant appliances such as stoves, dishwashers, washers, and dryers
Large household toys or other oversized items
Refrigerant appliances collected separately through the GoRecycle program
not_accepted_items: Items not registered in DTRITUS or unsafe for collection
limits: Book up to four items per appointment or twelve for multi-residential properties. Items must be placed at the curb after 7:00 p.m. before collection day and before 7:00 a.m. on collection day, keeping sidewalks clear.
fees: Curbside bulky pickups are free. Refrigerant appliance pickups are free via GoRecycle. Ecocentre drop-off fees depend on material type and quantity.
holiday_shifts: Collections do not occur on December 25 or January 1 and shift by one day during those weeks; check DTRITUS for updates.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping via Gatineau 311 online or by phone. Call emergency services for incidents in progress.
notes_public: Schedule bulky pickups through the DTRITUS app. Register each item, set them out between 7 p.m. and 7 a.m., and use GoRecycle or ecocentres for excluded materials such as toilets or refrigerant appliances.
seo_text: Gatineau residents schedule bulky item pickups through the DTRITUS app. Book up to four items per request, set them out the night before collection, and use GoRecycle or ecocentres for refrigerant appliances and other excluded materials.

source_title: City of Markham - Furniture and Bulky Items
fine_range: Penalties vary under municipal bylaws and may include fines for improper set-outs.
notes_admin: Bulky items are collected every other week on clear bag garbage days with a three-item limit. Appliances and large metal items are collected monthly by appointment with fees for appliances.
schedule_pattern: Bulky items: every other week on clear bag garbage day; set out by 7:00 a.m. Appliances and large metal items: monthly by appointment.
eligible_items: Sofas and couches
Chairs
Mattresses and box springs
Toilets with separated components for two-piece units
Bundled wood up to 1.2 meters long and 18 kilograms
Rolled carpet tied within size and weight limits
not_accepted_items: Large appliances set out without an appointment
Large metal items without an appointment
limits: Three bulky items per collection. Wood bundles and carpet rolls must be tied, under 1.2 meters long, and weigh less than 18 kilograms. Apartment and condo residents must work with property managers.
fees: Bulky collection is included in service. Appliance pickup costs $18.50 per appliance starting January 2025. Large metal item pickup is free. Drop-off facilities may charge fees depending on materials.
holiday_shifts: If a statutory holiday falls between Tuesday and Friday, collection shifts one day later. Check the collection schedule for updates.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report through the City's online portal or call Access Markham. Contact York Region for dumping on regional roads.
notes_public: Set bulky items out by 7 a.m. on clear bag garbage weeks with a three-item limit. Schedule monthly appliance or metal pickups and remove fridge or freezer doors before collection. Use depots for renovation debris, electronics, or hazardous waste.
seo_text: Markham collects bulky items every other week on clear bag garbage day with a three-item limit. Book monthly appliance and metal pickups, follow size rules for wood and carpet, and check holiday shifts in the collection calendar.

source_title: Niagara Region - Large Item Collection
fine_range: Varies by violation.
notes_admin: Niagara Region runs large item collection for St. Catharines. Book at least two business days before your garbage day. The program covers up to four items per collection for houses and small apartment buildings.
schedule_pattern: Submit an online or phone request at least two business days before your garbage day. Set booked items out after 5:00 p.m. the night before and by 7:00 a.m. on collection day.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, chairs, and tables
Mattresses and box springs
Rolled and tied carpet or underpadding
Disassembled two-piece toilets
Large plastic household items
limits: Book up to four large items per collection. Houses and buildings with two to six units are eligible. Items are not collected if placed before 5:00 p.m. the night prior.
