fees: Large item pickup is included. Niagara Region drop-off depots charge minimum and per-tonne fees and surcharges for select items such as appliances with refrigerants or mattresses.
holiday_shifts: Most holidays do not affect collection, but confirm your schedule in the Niagara Region waste calendar or app.
notes_public: Book online or by phone and place no more than four large items at the curb by 7 a.m. on your garbage day. Do not set out appliances or metal items - take those to a Niagara Region drop-off depot.
seo_text: St. Catharines residents schedule Niagara Region large item pickup at least two business days ahead. Set out up to four bulky items by 7 a.m. on garbage day and bring appliances or metal items to a Regional depot.

source_title: Capital Regional District - Hartland Landfill Public Drop-Off Depot
complaint_channel: City of Victoria Bylaw Services or Public Works
fine_range: Varies by violation.
notes_admin: The City of Victoria does not provide routine bulky pickup. Residents self-haul large items to the CRD Hartland Landfill Public Drop-Off Depot or arrange private collection.
schedule_pattern: Deliver bulky items to the Hartland Landfill Public Drop-Off Depot during posted hours (generally Monday through Saturday). Check current hours and rates before visiting.
eligible_items: Furniture and other large household items
Mattresses and box springs
Large appliances, including refrigerant units
Scrap metal and electronics
Yard and garden material
not_accepted_items: Materials banned by CRD disposal rules
Demolition or renovation waste without required approvals
Explosives, biomedical waste, or radioactive materials
limits: No curbside bulky service. Follow Hartland load size limits and preparation requirements; some materials need permits or pre-approval.
fees: General refuse is charged by weight (for example, $155 per tonne plus bin fee). Many recyclables, electronics, and hazardous materials are accepted at no charge. Fees vary by item category.
holiday_shifts: Hartland hours and City collection schedules may change on statutory holidays; verify before hauling.
notes_public: Victoria has no citywide bulky pickup. Self-haul items to Hartland, where many recyclables are free but general refuse is charged by weight. Report illegal dumping to Bylaw Services.
seo_text: Victoria does not offer curbside bulky pickup. Take large items to the CRD Hartland Landfill Public Drop-Off Depot, review current fees, and report illegal dumping to the City.

source_title: City of Edmonton - Eco Stations and EWMC Disposal Rates
fine_range: Varies by municipality.
notes_admin: Households in the Edmonton metro area typically handle bulky items by dropping them at City of Edmonton Eco Stations or the Edmonton Waste Management Centre. Surrounding municipalities host seasonal large-item pickups and Big Bin-style events.
schedule_pattern: Eco Stations are open daily (usually 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.) and closed on statutory holidays. The EWMC operates during standard business hours. Seasonal Big Bin events have published dates.
eligible_items: Bulky furniture and mattresses
Large appliances, including refrigerant units
Electronics and household hazardous waste at Eco Stations
Scrap metal
Passenger or ATV tires within posted limits
not_accepted_items: Non-residential hazardous waste at Eco Stations
Specific restricted materials such as elm wood at Eco Stations
limits: Eco Stations accept vehicles up to approximately one tonne with trailers under three meters. Oversized loads must use the EWMC. Municipal event pickups impose local item and quantity limits.
fees: EWMC residential disposal is typically $72 per tonne with a $20 minimum. Surcharges apply to mattresses and refrigerant appliances. Many items, including electronics and scrap metal, are free at Eco Stations. Big Bin events are free for residents.
holiday_shifts: Eco Stations are closed on statutory holidays. Big Bin events are seasonal and may be cancelled during severe weather.
notes_public: Use Eco Stations or the EWMC for bulky items, watch for free Big Bin events, and check your municipality for seasonal curbside programs. Report illegal dumping through 311.
seo_text: Edmonton-area residents drop bulky items at Eco Stations or the EWMC. Electronics and hazardous waste are free at Eco Stations, with small surcharges for mattresses and refrigerant appliances. Big Bin events provide seasonal no-cost disposal opportunities.

source_title: City of Chicago - Sanitation Code and Bulk Pick-Up Guidance
fine_range: Illegal dumping penalties range from $1,500 to $30,000 depending on load size with vehicle impound fees.
notes_admin: Bulk set-outs and white goods are collected by the Department of Streets and Sanitation for one- to four-unit residences. Residents can place bulky items next to refuse carts on garbage day or request a 311 bulk or appliance pick-up. Larger buildings must use private haulers.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky items next to City refuse carts by 7:00 a.m. on your scheduled garbage day. For appliances or oversized piles, submit a 311 request or contact your ward superintendent.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, tables, chairs, and dressers
Mattresses and box springs sealed in plastic and labeled if infested
Other bulky household items that do not fit in the refuse cart
Appliances including refrigerators, freezers, stoves, washers, and dryers (doors removed and scheduled via 311)
not_accepted_items: Electronics (take to the Household Chemicals and Computer Recycling Facility)
limits: Do not block alleys or sidewalks. Refrigerators and freezers must have doors removed. Bed bug ordinance requires sealing and labeling infested items. DSS service applies only to one- to four-unit residences.
fees: Bulk collection is included in regular service. Electronics and hazardous waste drop-off at HCCRF is free for residents.
holiday_shifts: No collection occurs on City-defined non-scheduled garbage holidays; service shifts to the next business day.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping to 311 with location details. Call 911 if hazardous materials are involved.
notes_public: Place bulky items by 7 a.m. on garbage day and submit a 311 request for appliances or oversized piles. Remove doors from refrigerators and freezers, bag and label infested items, and take electronics or hazardous waste to the City drop-off facility.
seo_text: Chicago residents can set bulky items next to City refuse carts on garbage day and request 311 pick-ups for appliances. Remove refrigerator doors, bag infested mattresses, and take electronics or hazardous waste to the Household Chemicals and Computer Recycling Facility.

source_title: City of Regina - Landfill Information
fine_range: Varies by bylaw.
notes_admin: Regina does not offer municipal bulky pickup. Residents must self-haul bulky waste to the City Landfill or hire a private hauler. The landfill publishes accepted materials, small-load rates, and refrigerant appliance charges.
schedule_pattern: No curbside bulky service. Deliver items during posted landfill hours (seasonal schedules apply). Hazardous materials are accepted separately at the Household Hazardous Materials Depot.
eligible_items: Furniture and household junk
Mattresses and box springs
Appliances (empty; refrigerant units incur a surcharge)
Scrap metal and shingles
Standard municipal garbage or rubble
not_accepted_items: Household hazardous waste at the landfill
limits: Self-haul only. Small-load rates apply to vehicles with loads up to 200 kilograms; heavier loads are charged by weight. Loads must be tarped and secured. Refrigerant appliances must be empty and incur an additional fee.
fees: Standard waste is $10 for loads up to 200 kilograms and $95 per tonne for heavier loads. Refrigerant removal costs $10 per appliance in addition to disposal fees. Payment is accepted at the scale house by cash, debit, Visa, or Mastercard.
holiday_shifts: Landfill hours vary seasonally and on holidays; check the City website for updates.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping to Service Regina at 306-777-7000 or via the online service request form.
notes_public: Regina has no curbside bulky pickup. Take sofas, mattresses, and appliances to the City Landfill or hire a private hauler. Bring hazardous waste to the HHM Depot and recycle electronics at SARCAN depots.
seo_text: Regina residents must take bulky items to the City Landfill - there is no curbside pickup. Review landfill fees, HHM Depot hours, and recycling options for electronics, paint, and tires.

source_title: City of Surrey - Large Item Pickup Program
complaint_channel: City of Surrey Waste Collection Services
fine_range: Illegal dumping fines can reach $10,000.
notes_admin: Surrey provides free on-call large item pickup for eligible households. Single-family homes can schedule up to six items per year (eight with a registered secondary suite). Multi-family buildings with City recycling have a separate registered program.
schedule_pattern: Book online or by phone and place items at the designated location by 7:30 a.m. on the scheduled day. Leave items accessible until 7:30 p.m. as different trucks collect different materials.
eligible_items: Furniture such as sofas, tables, and dressers
Mattresses and box springs sealed in clear plastic bags
Large appliances including refrigerators, stoves, and washers
Electronics and boxed small appliances
Exercise equipment and outdoor furniture without propane tanks
not_accepted_items: Mirrors or large glass (remove and self-haul)
limits: Up to six items per household per year (eight with a registered secondary suite). Apartments and condos with City recycling can schedule four items per unit per year through property managers. Mattresses must be bagged in clear plastic.
fees: Large item pickup is free within annual limits. Self-haul disposal fees follow Metro Vancouver rates.
holiday_shifts: Regular pickups occur on most holidays except December 25 and January 1. If your booking falls on these dates, the City will provide a new appointment date.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report issues online or call 604-591-4152. Items placed out without a booking may be treated as illegal dumping.
notes_public: Book Surrey's free large item pickup for furniture, mattresses, appliances, electronics, and more. Keep items accessible all day, bag mattresses, remove propane tanks, and use the program sticker system for condo pickups.
seo_text: Surrey's Large Item Pickup Program lets households schedule up to six items per year for free. Bag mattresses, remove propane tanks, and keep items accessible for collection between 7:30 a.m. and 7:30 p.m.

source_title: City of Richmond Hill - Garbage and Recycling at Your Home
fine_range: Fines up to $5,000 for illegal dumping; lower penalties for other waste bylaw offences.
notes_admin: Richmond Hill collects bulky items with garbage every other week. Each bulky item counts toward the three-item garbage limit. Appliances and large metal items require separate monthly appointments.
schedule_pattern: Set bulky items out on your garbage collection day by 7:00 a.m. (6:00 a.m. in the downtown core) and no earlier than 6:00 p.m. the night before. Garbage is collected every other week.
eligible_items: Couches and sofas
Chairs
Mattresses and box springs
Toilets with separated tanks and bowls unless one-piece
Dressers and other non-metal furniture
Wrapped and labeled glass or mirrors
not_accepted_items: Appliances and metal items on regular garbage day
limits: Three garbage items per collection; each large item counts as one. Maximum weight 68 kilograms and length six feet. Remove uncollected material by 9:00 p.m. the evening of collection. Toilets must be separated if two-piece.
fees: Bulky collection is included. Appliances and metal items are collected monthly by free appointment. Garbage tags for additional items cost extra, and regional depots may charge for certain drop-offs.
holiday_shifts: When a statutory holiday (excluding Boxing Day) falls on a collection day, service shifts one day later for that week. Consult the Waste Management Calendar.
illegal_dumping_reporting: Report illegal dumping to Access Richmond Hill at 905-771-8800 or access@richmondhill.ca. Online reporting is also available.
notes_public: Set bulky furniture out on your garbage day within the three-item limit. Book monthly appliance or metal pickups separately, wrap and label glass, and take electronics or hazardous items to York Region depots.
seo_text: Richmond Hill collects bulky furniture with garbage every other week. Follow the three-item limit, schedule appliance and metal pickups separately, and check holiday shifts using the address lookup tool.
